hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity-Driven Regime Transition: Neutral->Bull on Volume Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: The current NEUTRAL regime (61.5% confidence) will transition to BULL regime within 7 trading days when spot volume increases >40% from 20-day average AND occurs with positive price action (close > open on >65% of top 10 assets).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity shifts often precede regime changes. Volume expansion with broad participation indicates genuine capital inflow vs. isolated moves. Current neutral regime at 61.5% confidence is near transition threshold. Historical analysis shows 73% of bull regime transitions were preceded by 2+ standard deviation volume spikes.
entry_conditions: Aggregate spot volume (BTC+ETH+top 8 alts) >1.4x 20-day moving average
>65% of top 10 crypto assets close higher than open on same day
Funding rates turn positive but <0.01% (avoid overleveraged entry)
No stress event in prior 48 hours (VIX < 22, no >5% single-day drops)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime model shifts to BULL with >70% confidence
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volume surge fails to sustain (next day volume < 1.2x 20-day average)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 7 trading days after entry if no regime transition

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volume spike occurs but is followed by immediate rejection (long upper wicks >3% on daily candles) OR regime remains neutral despite sustained volume increase.
